topic.title: Mixtape : new music site
topic.body:
Hi everyone,

I have published my new project call Mixtape. It is a collaborative playlist site. It has lots of bug that I am trying to fix. If anyone want to contribute or report a bug it would be much appreciated.

A small explanation of how it works :
* It use the big file feature for songs.
* Every playlist is a hub. The site doesn't offer the possibility to create one but you should be able to clone one of the hub that are already available.
* You can also manage permission. The playlist can be read only or public or just give access to a couple of people. A more detailed guide on how to do that will come soon.

What to expect for the future:
* A page to manage your playlist
* Better user experience (the code need some refactoring)
* Follow update of playlist
* Desktop application - experimental - This could be achieved by using electron and loading the url of the page and maybe some other cool feature if possible like notification.
* A plugin to quickly add a song listened on clearnet to your playlist or even other site like ZeroSTLN

Many exciting stuff to do !

PS : The address [Mixtape](/mixtape.bit)

topic.title: Looking into creating a browser for Zeronet
topic.body:
I have been looking into zeronet-kivy and python GUI framework.
I would like to create a Zeronet Browser POC. Having a native browser could give more control over the application and offer other opportunities for plugins and site. 

It would be great to be able to do it and using a lib to render site. The best one I have found is webkit and it seems to work great with PyQT. There is also https://pypi.org/project/cefpython3/ which seems to be compatible with a bunch of GUI framework. It doesnt seems to be maintain for kivy or it is maintain by a third party and doesnt really push update.

Using PyQT and webkit seems the right choice but PyQT seems to have a annoying license ? Might not be a problem because Zeronet is free. 

Other solution is the Beeware : https://pybee.org/project/using/desktop-app/
But seems quite a young project.

I also tested Pyinstaller to create ready to use app and dpkg to create packaging for linux. 

Here the state of my research. Please comment if you have feedback or other lib to add.

UPDATE: I finally chose to go with pyt5 : https://github.com/rllola/ZeronetBrowser

Using Electron would have require having 2 languages in one app making it more difficult to package, distribute and update. Also contrary to what it has been said javascript doesn't allow to embed python code (like for bindings in c++/python). It would just call the app and start it externally. Using IPC would have been a good solution for communication between the 2 processes. However it would have been a lot of work, lets keep it simple.

The project is open to PR ! I am focusing on packaging, distribution and update first and if anyone want to start adding features please do. You actually don't need to know that much python to start.

topic.title: Zeronet Torrent Plugin first release
topic.body:
I am happy to announce the first release of the Zeronet Torrent Plugin !
https://github.com/rllola/zeronet-torrent-plugin/releases/tag/v0.1.0

## How to install ?

You just need to download the release for your computer and extract it in the plugins folder under the name Torrent.

## Test

You can then run test.py to see if it is working. If not please fill a issue ticket with as much details as possible so I can help you with it.

## What it is for ?

It allows you to create download/seed files from the Torrent network. It is a bridge between both world.

## Important

It is not anonymous ! Please use it with caution and do not install if you want to stay anonymous. It as anonymous as Bittorrent. You can use it behind a VPN if you want.

## Sites which support the plugin

You can test it here : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL/

For any questions or requests I will be available here or you can contact me through ZeroMail.

topic.title: Version v0.3.1 torrent plugin
topic.body:
Here the latest version of the torrent plugin I have been working on. I have re-wrote it to be a lot simpler for dev to use (it is now really similar to how zeronet do it for optional file). Documentation will be published on the site.

You can find the plugin for py3 here : zero://1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL/

There is still python2 version files but those are outdated now. So if it shows python2 code it means that your are using python2 zeronet version and you should update it.

Once the plugin is installed you can just visit the site again and it should offer you a dead simple form in order to test the plugin with Sintel torrent

While zeronet is running it will seed the file but once zeronet stop running it will stop and starting again will not start sharing file again (this should come in next version).

In order to keep exploring this, your feedbacks are welcome. Please feel free to share them here.

!!! Important !!! Using this plugin will show your address IP (it doesn't use Tor) but you should be fine behind a VPN.

topic.title: Torrent plugin for ZeroNet
topic.body:
I have updated the Torrent plugin and Torrent plugin site.

[/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL](/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL)

It now supports BitTorrent v2. Careful using it because it will not make you anonymous even if you use ZeroNet with Tor.

This plugin allows you download files from the Torrent network.

## FAQ

### How to install it
You will need to install it via this site [/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL](/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL). Once it is installed you will be asked to restart ZeroNet and then refresh the site.

### How to use it
You will be presented with a form to add a torrent via either a magnet link or a .torrent file. To properly test if the plugin is working please click on the `sintel` link which will fill the form with the Sintel movie magnet and then submit.

You will need to wait a bit for it to connect to peers and start downloading the film. It will then show the video  player and you can start to watch Sintel as it is being downloaded.

### How to stop it
Once you have stopped ZeroNet or disabled the plugin (using [/Plugins](/Plugins)) the torrent will not be shared anymore.

### Where is the file saved
The file will be saved in your `data` folder under the folder of the site that it has been requested from (so here `1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL`) under a `downloads` folder (e.g `data/1ChMNjXpW5vU5iXb9DSXzqAUfY46Pc2RTL/downloads`).

### How can I hide my identity
Use a no-logging VPN.

### Where can it be used
It can only be used in site that supports and have implemented the specific api of the plugin. Documentation will be available soon. Devs can also take a look at this file for the available actions implemented by the plugin (https://github.com/rllola/zeronet-torrent-plugin-example/blob/master/app/stores/Site.js)

## Whats next
- UI page for the plugin (show list of torrents and save path)
- Configuration
- Dev documentation and tutorial

Important! This is still work in progress. Don't use it if you don't want to.

# UPDATE

New version out and should fix the issues mentioned in the comment. 
If you installed the plugin before, you will need to delete it. Go back to the site, install restart ZeroNet, refresh the page, grant the permission for the site and test the demo!

topic.title: Electrum NMC plugin
topic.body:
Here the install site for the Electrum NMC plugin : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BD92Qo8p2UnLfkdNeex9CgtYsn2LNAFnN/

This plugin allow to resolve .bit domain name without using the Zeroname site (so in a decentralized old fashion). It doesn't download the all block chain but only interesting tx by following the SPV protocol. IT desktop friendly.

This finally an old issue : https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/407

Nothing more has to be done after installing the plugin. It just work out of the box. You can `disabled` the `Zeroname` plugin.

Feedbacks are welcome.

1_17R9N6TFQ5u4MnbppJqbyXt9jNe1WkijRY.body:
> [akito](#comment_126_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): on its blockchain.
I don't remember reading anything about blockchain for ZeroNet. Only that it using Bitcoin cryptography. Could you point me where you have seen it mentioned ?

> [canvas](#comment_4_1CV1zQjkdRKBd9NNXBpVELvzXDp7puzUmX): In my understanding of Bitcoin cryptography, it is blockchain.

When people talk about the 'blockchain' they often refer to the consensus protocol and the way the data are stored or sometimes only the way the data are stored. For the first one I prefer call it the Proof-of-Work chain and not 'blockchain' like SN used to name it in his explanation ( [example here](http://satoshi.nakamotoinstitute.org/emails/cryptography/11/)(clearnet)) but ZeroNet does not use this specific part of the Bitcoin protocol. However, it does use the same cryptography as Bitcoin which is based on the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm or ECDSA.

> [akito](#comment_129_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): I think it would be better for you, if you actually gathered some information on the topic instead of throwing shit at a fan directed at us...

I apologize if you find my explanation uncomplete or false. I just tried to share details of my understanding of ZeroNet and Bitcoin. This is the information that I gathered for a small presentation that I have done on the topic.

Also in the ZeroNet FAQ it is mentioned that ZeroNet doesn't use Bitcoin's blockchain. 
> Does ZeroNet use Bitcoin's blockchain?
>
>No, ZeroNet only uses the cryptography of Bitcoin for site addresses and content signing/verification. The users >identification is also based on Bitcoin's BIP32 format.
>
>Namecoin's blockchain is being used for domain registrations.

[link FAQ](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/) (clearnet)


@yinhongfei789 : You can also find more on ZeroNet protocol on this [PDF](https://zeronet.io/files/ZeroNet_Presentation.pdf) (clearnet)

1518637483_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbE.body:
> [flappyearz](#comment_153_1QEfmMwKVxgR4rkREbdJYjgUmF3Zy8pwHt): How was it?

I would say it went well. It was a small crowd really (12 people).

We started to talk about censorship and went through the Freedom House report from 2016. I tried then to explain in a really simple way how Zeronet works (might have lost a couple of people on the way). We then talked about the Zeronet advantages and particularities (Tor, Built-in account, Namecoin, Plugins, BigFile,...).

I ended the talk with a small demo and showcase what the community has build. 

I had the usual questions : "What happened if someone download child pornography ?"  and "But does it work on Blockchain ?"

A couple of people talked to me after so I would say it is a win.

I will probably publish the presentation somewhere soon but I want first to change a couple of things. It is always a work in progress.

1522801185_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbE.body:
> [nofish](#comment_1152_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It could work (if we add immutable data support), but it's not 100% sure as what if someone joins with 10000 nodes that are distributing different truth?

If you have the hash on several place you can prove it has existed somehow at one point in the past. If someone come with 10000 nodes they can create a new chain that's all. But the others want to keep it because it is the proof that their document has been timestamped they will ignore the new chain.

I am not really sure how it would work exactly. I have been reading the documents that are referenced in the Bitcoin whitepaper. I also realized that you might need a central server which would be sure that the items are chained and then distribute the hash to the others.

Or each and everyone could have is own hub with his own chain and from time to time you will add the hash of someone else chain in yours which would prove the existence.

I am just throwing ideas here. I haven't figure out how it would work.

> [zeropyro](#comment_14_1KsFe6vgVpNFCNTQDQryrcQYySkAbFLXCV): If nobody seed the video or a zite the download are not resume.Its failed IFS too.Does not help the +seed button in KopyKate or ZeroUp, if not have seeder the current time.Lot of files are dead in this zites.If you run a low visited zite the content.json download always faild because the zite download are not resume too.Low seeded zites are not correctly updated.If you not seed 24/7 your files or zite.And its not popular in the 0Net network,in this case becomes fast unavailable.The protocol is incomplete and have critical bugs.

I am sorry if you misunderstood how Zeronet works. It is a bittorrent like protocol. It is people responsibilities to seed files they want to share but as long as there is one it will be available to you. It is also possible to automatically download and support to help the network. Take a look at the files tab on the homepage.


People also made available proxies which can help seeding but you can also run it on 15$ small computer (if you still cannot afford this I am sure we can help you).


If you find bug, you can report them on the github page or here.


Also remember that devs and contributors are working for free. It is not always easy to find free time to work on ZeroNet site and this is why we are talking here about creating a fund.

This scenario seems really unlikely if a seeder start to seed the file at 12:00 it should be announced to you. I use to work with libtorrent however I am not sure how Zeronet handle this. I will take a look at the code but it might be a mechanism to save bandwidth. It might be trying to prioritize site you are trying to look at the present time. If it is the case it could be possible to configure this in the zeronet config file.

Also if you don't have the content.json downloaded you cannot know which file to download. So it might be another reason why it fails. The content.json contain the hashes of the files.

Also are we talking of about optional file ? It might be a different mechanism too.

@toyota

I entirely agree with you. I am going to try to clarify some points. 

>How? It is impossible without using VPN.
You can use torrent with Tor (https://www.best-bittorrent-vpn.com/tor-for-torrents.html) but it is difficult to configure and slow so a VPN is the way to go. 

>Otherwise anyone sharing a video is risk to a cease and desist, the same as when uploading content via a normal torrent client and no VPN.
Sharing pirated content is illegal and you risk to have problem is you do. But if you have the permission to share, it is fine. Let's say you created a small fun tv show on hacking you can share via torrent protocol and you won't get problems.

I have been working for 2 years with libtorrent. I never used a VPN to hide (and it is not good practice I was just lazy) and I never had a problem because I was using free torrents (https://www.freetorrent.fr/torrents.php <-- sorry it is in french)

>It is imo even more dangerous as people might not be aware they are revealing their iP automatically by clicking on any video thats copyrighted on your service. They think they are safe/protected by using ZN via tor=always, but your plugin is circumventing tor protection and risking anyone to be easilly exposed without a VPN.
It is why it is a plugin. You will have to install it on Zeronet. It won't be there by default only for people who want to use it. I will try to make it as clear as possible about the risk that you mentioned. It could also even be made unavailable if tor is activated to prevent any risk.

Remember this plugin was developed before BigFile where available (which would gave you access to streaming because webtorrent didn't really work well..). It is now just an attempt to get files from torrent network available here (like for example to be use as a bridge with PeerTube). If some people run it they also can make those files accessible for people who only use ZN. No one is forcing you to use it. It is just a fun project.

Blender and others are starting to use it. We could create a clone on ZeroNet allowing people to access without installing peertube and support the newtork at the same time.

Also last but not least libtorrent has been developed since 2001 and is pretty efficient.

> [freeperson](#comment_23_1QJVjdwjqjGfFp6CtxzWTu19HRusPi9ds6): If people are only connecting via the zero protocol is it more anonymous or does it expose ones IP address?

If you are using ZeroNet you are as anonymous as ZeroNet. If you have activated the plugin and are using it you are as anonymous as Bittorrent so yes your IP address is exposed. 

Just a note : it is the same for ZeroNet if you havent activated Tor. 

It is also why I have added the important section. To make sure people understand that by using the plugin you are exposed. You can however use a VPN and it will hide your IP address while using the plugin.
